title: 1989 NCAA Division I Men's Golf Championship
text:
The 1989 <a href="NCAA%20Division%20I%20Men%27s%20Golf%20Championships">NCAA Division I Men's Golf Championships</a> were contested at the 51st annual <a href="NCAA">NCAA</a>-sanctioned golf tournament for determining the individual and team national champions of men's <a href="golf">collegiate golf</a> at the <a href="Division%20I%20%28NCAA%29">Division I</a> level in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>.
The tournament was held at the <a href="Oak%20Tree%20Country%20Club">Oak Tree Country Club</a> in <a href="Edmond%2C%20Oklahoma">Edmond, Oklahoma</a>, a suburb of <a href="Oklahoma%20City">Oklahoma City</a>.
<a href="Oklahoma%20Sooners%20men%27s%20golf">Oklahoma</a> won the team championship, the Sooners' first NCAA title.
Future <a href="Professional%20golfer">professional</a> and five-time <a href="Men%27s%20major%20golf%20championships">major</a> champion <a href="Phil%20Mickelson">Phil Mickelson</a>, from <a href="Arizona%20State%20Sun%20Devils%20men%27s%20golf">Arizona State</a>, won the individual title, his first of three.
